summary: A will go to the animal shelter tomorrow to get a puppy for her son. They already visited the shelter last Monday and the son chose the puppy.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: A: Hi Tom, are you busy tomorrow’s afternoon?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: B: I’m pretty sure I am. What’s up?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: A: Can you go with me to the animal shelter?.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: B: What do you want to do?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: A: I want to get a puppy for my son.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: B: That will make him so happy.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: A: Yeah, we’ve discussed it many times. I think he’s ready now.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: B: That’s good. Raising a dog is a tough issue. Like having a baby ;-)

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: A: I'll get him one of those little dogs.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: B: One that won't grow up too big;-)

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: A: And eat too much;-))

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: B: Do you know which one he would like?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: A: Oh, yes, I took him there last Monday. He showed me one that he really liked.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: B: I bet you had to drag him away.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: A: He wanted to take it home right away ;-).

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: B: I wonder what he'll name it.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: A: He said he’d name it after his dead hamster – Lemmy  - he's  a great Motorhead fan :-)))

summary: Emma and Rob love the advent calendar. Lauren fits inside calendar various items, for instance, small toys and Christmas decorations. Her children are excited whenever they get the calendar.

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Emma: I’ve just fallen in love with this advent calendar! Awesome! I wanna one for my kids!

dialogue.speaker: Rob
dialogue.text: Rob: I used to get one every year as a child! Loved them!

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Emma: Yeah, i remember! they were filled with chocolates!

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: Lauren: they are different these days! much more sophisticated! Haha!

dialogue.speaker: Rob
dialogue.text: Rob: yeah, they can be fabric/ wooden, shop bought/ homemade, filled with various stuff

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Emma: what do you fit inside?

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: Lauren: small toys, Christmas decorations, creative stuff, hair bands & clips, stickers, pencils & rubbers, small puzzles, sweets

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Emma: WOW! That’s brill! X

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: Lauren: i add one more very special thing as well- little notes asking my children to do something nice for someone else

dialogue.speaker: Rob
dialogue.text: Rob: i like that! My sister adds notes asking her kids questions about christmas such as What did the 3 wise men bring? etc

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: Lauren: i reckon it prepares them for Christmas

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Emma: and makes it more about traditions and being kind to other people

dialogue.speaker: Lauren
dialogue.text: Lauren: my children get very excited every time they get one!

dialogue.speaker: Emma
dialogue.text: Emma: i can see why! :)

summary: Madison is pregnant but she doesn't want to talk about it. Patricia Stevens got married and she thought she was pregnant.

dialogue.speaker: Jackie
dialogue.text: Jackie: Madison is pregnant

dialogue.speaker: Jackie
dialogue.text: Jackie: but she doesn't wanna talk about it

dialogue.speaker: Iggy
dialogue.text: Iggy: why

dialogue.speaker: Jackie
dialogue.text: Jackie: I don't know why because she doesn't wanna talk about it

dialogue.speaker: Iggy
dialogue.text: Iggy: ok

dialogue.speaker: Jackie
dialogue.text: Jackie: I wanted to prepare you for it because people get super excited and ask lots of questions

dialogue.speaker: Jackie
dialogue.text: Jackie: and she looked way more anxious than excited

dialogue.speaker: Iggy
dialogue.text: Iggy: she's probably worrying about it

dialogue.speaker: Iggy
dialogue.text: Iggy: she's taking every commitment really seriously

dialogue.speaker: Jackie
dialogue.text: Jackie: it could be money problems or relationship problems

dialogue.speaker: Iggy
dialogue.text: Iggy: or maybe she wants an abortion

dialogue.speaker: Jackie
dialogue.text: Jackie: it could be all of the above

dialogue.speaker: Iggy
dialogue.text: Iggy: but you know what?

dialogue.speaker: Iggy
dialogue.text: Iggy: once my friend was pregnant and I couldn't bring myself to be happy about it

dialogue.speaker: Jackie
dialogue.text: Jackie: why?

dialogue.speaker: Iggy
dialogue.text: Iggy: I felt they were immature and I couldn't picture this couple as parents

dialogue.speaker: Jackie
dialogue.text: Jackie: I felt similar way on Patricia's wedding

dialogue.speaker: Iggy
dialogue.text: Iggy: Patricia Stevens?

dialogue.speaker: Jackie
dialogue.text: Jackie: yes

dialogue.speaker: Iggy
dialogue.text: Iggy: so we're talking about the same person

dialogue.speaker: Jackie
dialogue.text: Jackie: what a coincidence

dialogue.speaker: Jackie
dialogue.text: Jackie: so she's pregnant?

dialogue.speaker: Iggy
dialogue.text: Iggy: she thought she was

dialogue.speaker: Jackie
dialogue.text: Jackie: damn...

summary: Marla found a pair of boxers under her bed.

dialogue.speaker: Marla
dialogue.text: Marla: <file_photo>

dialogue.speaker: Marla
dialogue.text: Marla: look what I found under my bed

dialogue.speaker: Kiki
dialogue.text: Kiki: lol

dialogue.speaker: Tamara
dialogue.text: Tamara: is that someone's underwear?

dialogue.speaker: Marla
dialogue.text: Marla: it certainly isn't mine, my ass is big but it isn't huge

dialogue.speaker: Kiki
dialogue.text: Kiki: it looks like male underwear

dialogue.speaker: Tamara
dialogue.text: Tamara: not necessarily, maybe some butch had fun in your room while you were gone

dialogue.speaker: Marla
dialogue.text: Marla: ok but how can you leave your underwear after hooking up? wtf is wrong with people

dialogue.speaker: Kiki
dialogue.text: Kiki: she or he could be too wasted to notice

dialogue.speaker: Tamara
dialogue.text: Tamara: or maybe someone put their pants there to piss you off

dialogue.speaker: Marla
dialogue.text: Marla: that makes no sense

dialogue.speaker: Marla
dialogue.text: Marla: it's so fucking childish

dialogue.speaker: Kiki
dialogue.text: Kiki: if it's childish then it must have been your sister's idea

dialogue.speaker: Marla
dialogue.text: Marla: she's 13, she doesn't have underwear that isn't pink

dialogue.speaker: Tamara
dialogue.text: Tamara: maybe it belonged to one of your exes?

dialogue.speaker: Kiki
dialogue.text: Kiki: she would have recognized it

dialogue.speaker: Marla
dialogue.text: Marla: lol we're doing total CSI investigation on one pair of boxers :D

dialogue.speaker: Kiki
dialogue.text: Kiki: <file_gif>

dialogue.speaker: Tamara
dialogue.text: Tamara: lol

dialogue.speaker: Tamara
dialogue.text: Tamara: I think your sister convinced someone to put their underwear in your room as a dare

dialogue.speaker: Marla
dialogue.text: Marla: sounds legit

dialogue.speaker: Kiki
dialogue.text: Kiki: Tamara, you just cracked the case!

dialogue.speaker: Tamara
dialogue.text: Tamara: <file_gif>

dialogue.speaker: Tamara
dialogue.text: Tamara: always happy to help

summary: Robert wants Fred to send him the address of the music shop as he needs to buy guitar cable.

dialogue.speaker: Robert
dialogue.text: Robert: Hey give me the address of this music shop you mentioned before

dialogue.speaker: Robert
dialogue.text: Robert: I have to buy guitar cable

dialogue.speaker: Fred
dialogue.text: Fred: <file_other>

dialogue.speaker: Fred
dialogue.text: Fred: Catch it on google maps

dialogue.speaker: Robert
dialogue.text: Robert: thx m8

dialogue.speaker: Fred
dialogue.text: Fred: ur welcome

summary: Megan needn't buy milk and cereals. They're in the drawer next to the fridge.

dialogue.speaker: Keith
dialogue.text: Keith: Meg, pls buy some milk and cereals, I see now we've run out of them

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Megan: hm, sure, I can do that

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Megan: but did you check in the drawer next to the fridge?

dialogue.speaker: Keith
dialogue.text: Keith: nope, let me have a look

dialogue.speaker: Keith
dialogue.text: Keith: ok, false alarm, we have cereal and milk :D

dialogue.speaker: Megan
dialogue.text: Megan: <file_gif>

summary: Samantha and Evelyn after watching the video cannot believe she is able to make that noise.

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Samantha: <file_video>

dialogue.speaker: Evelyn
dialogue.text: Evelyn: LOL

dialogue.speaker: Holly
dialogue.text: Holly: Is SHE making that noise??

dialogue.speaker: Samatha
dialogue.text: Samatha: Yes (＾▽＾)

dialogue.speaker: Holly
dialogue.text: Holly: How possible?? :o

dialogue.speaker: Samantha
dialogue.text: Samantha: Idk, I'm also surprised!!

dialogue.speaker: Evelyn
dialogue.text: Evelyn: xD

summary: Tom's new place is in Fiesole. Luis and Marion has been there.

dialogue.speaker: Theresa
dialogue.text: Theresa: have you been at Tom's new place?

dialogue.speaker: Luis
dialogue.text: Luis: yes, it's nice

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: Marion: He invited us for a dinner

dialogue.speaker: Adam
dialogue.text: Adam: where is it?

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: Marion: a bit outside the city

dialogue.speaker: Adam
dialogue.text: Adam: where exactly?

dialogue.speaker: Marion
dialogue.text: Marion: Fiesole

dialogue.speaker: Luis
dialogue.text: Luis: very nice!

summary: Jane made a 9 PM reservation for 6 people tonight at Vegano Resto.

dialogue.speaker: Jane
dialogue.text: Jane: Hello

dialogue.speaker: Vegano Resto
dialogue.text: Vegano Resto: Hello, how may I help you today?

dialogue.speaker: Jane
dialogue.text: Jane: I would like to make a reservation.

dialogue.speaker: Jane
dialogue.text: Jane: For 6 people, tonight around 20:00

dialogue.speaker: Vegano Resto
dialogue.text: Vegano Resto: Let me just check.

dialogue.speaker: Vegano Resto
dialogue.text: Vegano Resto: Ah, I'm afraid that there is no room at 20:00.

dialogue.speaker: Vegano Resto
dialogue.text: Vegano Resto: However, I could offer you a table for six at 18:30 or at 21:00

dialogue.speaker: Vegano Resto
dialogue.text: Vegano Resto: Would either of those times suit you?

dialogue.speaker: Jane
dialogue.text: Jane: Oh dear.

dialogue.speaker: Jane
dialogue.text: Jane: Let me just ask my friends.

dialogue.speaker: Vegano Resto
dialogue.text: Vegano Resto: No problem.

dialogue.speaker: Jane
dialogue.text: Jane: 21:00 will be ok.

dialogue.speaker: Vegano Resto
dialogue.text: Vegano Resto: Perfect. So tonight at 21:00 for six people under your name.

dialogue.speaker: Jane
dialogue.text: Jane: great, thank you!

summary: Nancy's working in Texas, but the kids laugh at her Welsh accent. She's coming home in 6 weeks. Earlier than that she's going to travel with 3 other Brits.

dialogue.speaker: Nancy
dialogue.text: Nancy: Howdy, how y'all doin'?

dialogue.speaker: Tina
dialogue.text: Tina: Is that a Texan drawl, girl?

dialogue.speaker: Nancy
dialogue.text: Nancy: Yes ma'am! Loving it out here!

dialogue.speaker: Tina
dialogue.text: Tina: How's the job going? Kids behaving themselves?

dialogue.speaker: Nancy
dialogue.text: Nancy: Mostly! They laugh at my accent though!

dialogue.speaker: Tina
dialogue.text: Tina: Well, they probably haven't met a Welsh person before!

dialogue.speaker: Nancy
dialogue.text: Nancy: No shit! They ask me to repeat everything! Best one is "Water", course, it's mostly "Waarderr" here!

dialogue.speaker: Tina
dialogue.text: Tina: LOL. I'd love to hear that, you picked up the accent yet?

dialogue.speaker: Nancy
dialogue.text: Nancy: Nah, 21 years in Cardiff isn't easily removed!

dialogue.speaker: Tina
dialogue.text: Tina: We're missing you here, the pub is quiet these days without your laugh!

dialogue.speaker: Nancy
dialogue.text: Nancy: Miss you too! I'm coming home in 6 weeks, though. Last fortnight I'm going travelling with 3 other Brits working here, a Geordie girl, a guy from Belfast and Annie, who's from Glasgow.

dialogue.speaker: Tina
dialogue.text: Tina: My God, I'm so jealous! I bet they had even more trouble being understood out there! See you after your trip!
